website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive option that gives pet owners the security of a plastic cone with a soft area around the collar.
pros: Offered in 2 sizes and 3 colors to match your pet's needs
Very lightweight design, yet it has a stiffness to it not found with foam collars
Uses an easy-to-use snap enclosure to keep the recovery collar in place as the pet moves
cons: Only made for small pets like cats, small dogs, and rabbits
Not as comfortable as some other options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small breeds like Cornish Rexes.
customer_reviews.text: This by far the best cone of Shane for small cats like our Cornish Rex. I like that I can extend it out further so it prevents him for getting at his recent cut. We expect to need this a lot as Rexes are accident prone. Balance is not their strong suit but more adventurous than any breed I've ever owned. A bad combination so I'm thrilled this works so well. It's stylish too although my Rex "Nigel" didn't think so. He wasn't mad- that's how he looks when he's talking to you. Lol
customer_reviews.author: A Ford

customer_reviews.title: It makes it more comfortable for my kitty and so she eont get hurt
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my kitty after she got fixed. It came in cery quickly. The reason why I got this one jd because of the soft part at the end. It makes it more comfortable for my kitty and so she eont get hurt. The reason I gave this 4 stars is because when she went to drink water the water got on the plush part which then soaked it up. Then she went right into the litter box and then it got full of litter because the collar was wet. But otherwise it is a great collar!
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I felt cruel but it works well. I have a kitty with flea dermatitis. She has over groomed bald spots all over her underside. This really helps but she acts paralyzed. She was so mad that even after I removed it, she hid for the rest of the evening. Based on other reviews I purchased a Medium and it's a great fit. Middle setting is perfect. Not too tight or loose for my 11 pound fur baby. Btw, the red is more of a pink.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Diane

customer_reviews.title: I would not Recommend this collar.  Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this cause my cat was having surgery on 11/12/2018. This collar cone did not stay on my cat. She managed to get it off every time I put it on her. It is completely worthless. The snaps broke before I could even put it back on my cat - I was careful prying them apart but they still broke. More money down the drain..... I would not Recommend this collar. Very Cheap. Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Carter

customer_reviews.title: It's Just OK
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, we put this on a 5 month old 5-6 lb kitten, and the small was just big enough at the last position. Secondly, The collar was soft, and comfortable for the cat, but the edge of the collar (that is away from the cats neck) is a soft material that repeatedly got dirty with litter and water. Lastly, as another person had done, I'd cut off that edge (I have not yet) if I needed to use it again, or buy one without such an absorbent and easily dirtied edge in the future.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it but works
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my cat would not stop scratching herself around the neck area, as she has a skin condition that got infected. She hated it at first and for two days would not eat drink or go to potty, but by 3rd day she was doing ok, you have to persevere. Anyway it fits good, the only thing I found was my cat head is small so I had to cut around the edges by 1 inch and duck tape it in place, so she could eat and drink and see around her, she has had it on for 1 month now and she is healing nicely so it works
customer_reviews.author: Duranie

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: 5.5lb kitten was spayed today. I bought This just in case she wanted to lick her wound and sure enough....as soon as I got her home she was at it. Glad I was prepared (so she didn't have to wear The hard plastic one from The vet). The smallest setting fits well (she wiggled out of the largest setting). It's functional, the soft neck allows her little head to come out of the cone slightly but she can't reach her wounds.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and WAY easier to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: This cone fit my 15 pound tabby cat beautifully. I bought the medium size and there are three levels of tightness and he fits on the middle one. The size the vet gave me said “10 cm” if that helps. Pros: -Simple to get on and off -MUCH more comfortable for my cat -The plastic part is clear and easier for him to see through. The one the vet game me was cloudy so it was like having blinders on. -Easy to clean Cons: None! Seriously. I don’t know why the vet doesn’t just use these instead (well I do, I’m sure cost, but these aren’t expensive and totally worth it!). Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Norman!
customer_reviews.text: This cone is amazing! Our car Norman has had terrible anxiety since we got him fixed and proceeds to lick himself everywhere. He licks so bad that he gets open wounds which I've had to take him to the vet for to prevent infections and death. Nothing was working to get him to stop so we resorted to a cone. And this is great! The padding to prevent scratching around the neck is very nice, and the cone is very sturdy. I would recommend! One more thing, get a medium size for a full sized cat. That's what I did and it fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: skylar

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product is much better than the hard platic cones the vet sends them home with. Soft material around the neck, which is great for comfort but loses a little of its stiffness fairly quick from wear. My cat kept pushing the cone into things and the soft neck started to fold under, pressing into her throat. I found myself repeatedly fixing it throughout the day. However that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: S. Heaney

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable Cone
customer_reviews.text: No one (including the vet) had a cone small enough for our little cat. The vet had altered a cone, but it made her miserable. When I received this one, she was instantly much happier. It's more comfortable (the part fastening around the neck is all fabric, but the plastic part allows her to still have peripheral vision) and she is fully mobile, able to do just about everything (running, jumping, eating) except scratch her injured eye. She doesn't even seem to mind wearing this cone. Unfortunately, I have to order a new one as she managed to get so much poop on it that spot-cleaning is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: modernvoid

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: These are so cute, and much comfier than the hard plastic ones from the vet's office. Also, the price is great & it fit my kittens (about 5 months old) very well! It's lightweight & semi flexible but still effective. No problem with the cats slipping out of it, as long as you use the right snaps. It will seem too tight, but that's how it needs to fit to stay on. The kittens could still eat, drink, and get around well. I definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: chocolatepi

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than vet cone/e-collar
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this cone! While my cat is still not thrilled about having to wear one, she adapted to this one much better than the hard plastic one from the vet. It’s shallower (see photo) which is better for her to eat/drink and the clear plastic allows her to see better. It’s still hard plastic but a bit more flexible than the vet one so she fell asleep in about 2 minutes! She’s an adult cat a little over 8 lbs and the medium fits her, so keep that in mind for sizing. At the right angle she could probably still lick her back paws, but I think you’re safe for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: BEST E-COLLAR FOR KITTENS!
customer_reviews.text: Our boy had gotten neutered and we had to pay $11 for the plastic e-collar provided by the vet. The collar was AWFUL & WAY TOO BIG. He kept getting it off and we would catch him trying to lick his stitches so we had to find one that fit his tiny neck and was comfy for him as well. This collar is great! I got the smallest size and it fit perfectly. He has not been able to get it off at all cause of the snap buttons and has given me peace of mind! I have been able to not follow him around constantly worrying that he will get it off. MUST BUY FOR KITTENS!
customer_reviews.author: Bre McAlister

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase very happy keeps my kitten safe and comfy after surgery
customer_reviews.text: I love this cone. My little kitten got spayed and had a reaction to the stitches and she’s had to wear a cone for longer and it’s very important that she not be able to mess with her incision. I love this cone. She’s only about 5 lbs so she was able to slip out of both the cones that the vet gave us. She has yet to come out of this cone 4 days in. Absolutely recommend I might buy a size up to have one hand. Very happy and she seems very comfy. The cone is a combo of hard on the edge and soft around the collar so it’s comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: KNS

customer_reviews.title: Good For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Had to get this for my cat Squeaker because she bites at herself and over grooms. Don't quite know what it's caused by yet- could be anxiety, could be itchy skin, but whatever its caused by this does help. It's not perfect. She still manages to lock the base of her tail but this has definitely cut back on the damage she does to herself. She can sleep, eat, drink, and play just like she could before. I like its its semi clear so she can still have a sense of her surroundings which all cats need to feel more secure with themselves. Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rat

customer_reviews.title: Easy on. Easy off.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this cat cone! So easy to put on and take off. Easy to clean and my cat prefers it to his hard hospital cone. The only issue for us is that the cone needs to be about 1/2 inch to 1 inch higher. My cat had surgery on his jaw and he can easily get his head extended to rub against things. Most cone are longer. I think the fabric pulls it down a bit. I do use it while we are together but have to put the harder cone on at night for safety. Would be great for most all uses.
customer_reviews.author: mbear

customer_reviews.title: Better than the one Vet sent home
customer_reviews.text: Great cone for cats. Shorter than the one the vet sent home so kitty could walk around the house and get up on his cat post or tables and couch. Easy to snap on and off quickly. Soft around the neck. All that being said, kitty had problems getting in and out of the litter box and eating with it on. The cone was still a bit long and he had a tendency to keep his head low and down the the ground, which made it difficult for him to eat or step in and out of the littler box.
customer_reviews.author: radiantdance

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 3.5 month old kitten, post-neutering
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy got neutered when he was 3.5 months old, but the cone that the vet provided was too large around the neck. So we ordered this cone, and it fit wonderfully. It is lightweight and allows him to eat, drink, and walk around without too much trouble. He is unable to lick his incisions, but can still operate almost completely normal. The cone is easy to put on and take off for a person, but the snaps make it so that the kitten can't take it off themselves. I would recommend this cone to anyone who needs to keep a small cat or kitten from licking his wounds post-surgery.
customer_reviews.author: M. Browning

customer_reviews.title: snaps didn't match
customer_reviews.text: My cat had 5 places on her face that needed protection from her scratching. I ordered this for one day delivery. When I began to put it on her neck, only 1 snap connected. The rest did not match anywhere. I wrote, asking the community, someone suggested it was made wrong and I should return it. I HAD to protect her face (it was bleeding). So, I taped it into place. Unfortunate. I think it will do what I need but also think it was made wrong. Thus, 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: exflyer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This was comfy an fit my 4 pound kitten just right for about 1 week. Then she figured out how to push against the plastic portion, thus pushing the padded collar down. This allowed her to reach her front paw which is what I was trying to prevent. Medium was way too big so I had to revert to the uncomfy vet cone when I couldn't supervise her. If it was for a spay type incision, I still think it would've worked. But it really needs stays in the padded portion. Too bad, it's cute.
customer_reviews.author: booklover777

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the all plastic ones you get from the vet
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my almost 7-month-old cats after they got neutered. They were miserable when I used the hard plastic e-collar from the vet. They weren't able to eat on their own so I had to hold the bowl for them. One of them water boarded himself when he tried to use the water fountain. I can tell that they are much happier with these new collars. They are able to eat and drink on their own and they are able to get into many more comfy positions for napping. I went with the small size and it seems to be a perfect fit using the larger sized snaps.
customer_reviews.author: Teressa F.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for my dog recovering from surgery
customer_reviews.text: We got this collar for our almost 5lb papillon puppy’s surgery recovery. I liked how the part closest to the neck is soft, I figured this would make it much more comfortable, especially for sleeping in. It fits her well. She is still able to get food and water from her bowls but definitely keeps her from licking/biting at her surgery scar on her stomach (spaying). The plastic portion is easy to wipe clean, the fabric part is annoying to clean, but worth the comfort. The price is definitely comparAble to the common pet stores, however, I didn’t find one with the fabric portion, which made me choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Customer3456776543456

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Product
customer_reviews.text: This Cone of Shame turned out to be a Cone of Pride for my little Morkie. She immediately liked it and had no trouble adjusting to it. I think because she could see through it and the neck was so comfortable that she wore it all the time. A much better product than the Stiff cloth one they give you at the vets office. This will definitely keep her from licking her stitches with no problems at all. I couldn’t be more pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fil

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! GET IT NOW
customer_reviews.text: We desperately needed a cone for our kitty. He weights about 3 pounds and we couldn't find a cone that fit him (either at our vet or the local pet stores). We ended up purchasing several different ones on Amazon, and this one was the only one that worked. Not only did it fit like a glove but also he wasn't able to take it off. Additionally, our baby had a bad reaction to the anesthesia and threw up, this thing is super easy to clean. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: liarantess

customer_reviews.title: Cat owner likes ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to get a standard hard cone on my cat, but the Bolbove semi-soft was easy to put on my cat. I did it quickly before she realized what had happened. Just wrap it around the cat's head like a blanket and snap 2 buttons together. Cats don't like cones, but the soft collar makes this one much more comfortable for her than a standard hard cone. So far, she has worn it 2 full days and one night. It is preventing her from chewing on a "hot spot" on the underside of her tail. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carmine

customer_reviews.title: Great Collar - Soft around the neck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 month old kitten after he was neutered. The one Banfield Pet Hospital charged $10 was a piece of junk! The Bolbove collar is super easy to put on. There is soft cloth around the neck so I image it's more comfortable than the plastic one from the vet. It's also cheaper and looks nicer. My kitten doesn't seem to have much of an issue eating food from his bowl from this collar. It sticks out just far enough so that he can't lick himself, but does't prevent him from eating.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn R

customer_reviews.title: Ok with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: The small fits perfect for our 1 year old kitties on the lowest setting (there are two settings). One managed to get it off but only because she was freaking out at first: The edge while soft and cute, unfortunately provides a place where they can hook their claws. Providing at least temporary distractions will help. If you're doing lime sulfur dips, it helps to keep them in an enclosure for warmth while drying. This will also prevent them from banging into things and freaking out more. I took one star off because the cone isn't long enough: Our cats could reach their tails and hind legs! Not ideal. This would be fine for spay/neuter surgeries though.
customer_reviews.author: Aliasa

customer_reviews.title: The snaps do not fit together.
customer_reviews.text: When adjusting for the smaller fit, the snaps do not line up. So you can use the first set of snaps or the second. You might be able to use both bottom snaps at once but the top snaps will not meet properly. Still more comfortable than the plastic one the vet provides. Not worth it to return so I’ll use it anyway. But if my kitten were more difficult this would not work. I’m probably going to purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael R. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Work fine.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten got a bite on her hendquarters and it got infected. she couldn't lick the antibiotic medication that we were putting into the wound because it would make her sick. The collar that the vet provided still enabled her to lick around the wound so I needed something a little bigger and this fit the bill. I like the padding around the throat area and she seen very comfortable in it. It wasn't too long.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Dr. Ordered!
customer_reviews.text: These things are ugly & make whatever is wearing it, miserable, but IT WORKS! My cat has a cut on his lip from fighting with the other cat & refused to leave it alone so it would. Of course it become infected. I was told to get those specific one because of how well it fit and adult cat, so we could treat the sore. My cat was mad for days! Didn't even want to look at me 😂 but his lip is fully healed now!
customer_reviews.author: Meghann1985

customer_reviews.title: too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The collar seems well made and would have been great if the fabric were not so flimsy. In other words, the fabric part collapses on itself and moves all over the place. As much as my cat hated wearing the cone of shame after surgery, he was much more comfortable in a cone made of sturdier material. He kept trying to use door frames to get out of this because he could feel it wasn't stable. Waste of money...only wore about 30 minutes:(
customer_reviews.author: K Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste of money. Even though I got the right size (I know because I bought a second one because the first one I bought was too small) it came right off with my cats struggle. I mean its obvious that the cat is going to try to take it off, and it should have crossed the mind of the person making it. We put it on my cat after getting her spayed and without much struggle, she took it right off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Deniz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cone for small cats!
customer_reviews.text: The edge does get wet when she drinks water, but I just twist it around. My cat is an adult, but small ( about 6 lbs). This cone must be comfortable because she didn't even try to take it off! With other comes she goes crazy until she figures out how to get it off. She has an over-grooming issue that causes sores. I tried the cat-onseies and she chewed a hole through it ( the sores also were wet, so they stuck the fabric ew! This has worked perfectly. It's small enough to not bother her but keeps her from licking herself!
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Stays on, is comfortable and has a clear view
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my two 14 week old kittens and the collars fit perfectly on them. They tried to take them off but couldn't so that was good. The collar part is soft which is nice for their neck, and the larger cone part is clear so they can see toys on the ground and food.I bought it because of the high reviews on Amazon and it didn't disappoint. So for those time when you pet needs a collar, I suggest buying these and giving them a try first. Much nicer than the harder plastic ones I saw at the vet.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good protection without discomfort
customer_reviews.text: I bought several different cones and finally landed on this one. My cat had surgery on her face I needed a cone to protect the area. I purchased a couple of softer cones but she could easily push them into her face so those didn’t work. This one is great, and much nicer than the one that we got from the vet’s office. It’s easy to put on and remove if need be. My cat’s neck is about 7 inches, which seems to suggest a small size would fit but we needed the medium.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This cone works perfectly on my 6lb cat. I will say this. I wish it was an inch longer all around. As I had to improvise and add an inch so she can’t get to her incision. She is a very feisty cat so I’m sure my other cat it would of worked great on. But this cat has gotten out of other devices. lol. She has been in this one for 24 hrs and can’t get loose. And she is still Abel to eat and drink.
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: The soft area around the neck collapse like a turtle neck. My deer head chihuahua’s nose still stuck out. She still could lick her foot and her hip. I returned this item and ended up buying a medium sized hard cone then cutting a large area off and punching new holes. This item would probably be fine for short muzzle dogs or cats but if your dog has a long neck and nose it wont work
customer_reviews.author: Kitten Fenerty

customer_reviews.title: This was great for my cat who had to wear it for ...
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my cat who had to wear it for 10 days while a wound was healing (so much better than the hard plastic ones the vet's provide). My cat was able to sleep and walk around in it comfortably. I would suggest taking it off while your cat eats if they eat wet-food (supervise them obviously) otherwise it does get messy. It was a little small so I used a pair of scissors to make a few cuts along the bottom of the collar to slightly widen it. When I did that it fit purrfectly ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel D

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful item
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much for this product! My little munchkin had surgery and was sent home with a flimsy cone with Velcro which is ridiculous and uncomfortable. This arrived in 24 hours and my kitty is so much more comfortable and it’s soft near her neck so I’m very happy with my purchase. Also my kitten is smaller than most and I liked the 2 sizes cause it fits her perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Samita Chandhok

customer_reviews.title: Made recovery much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a major surgery to remove a growth and the cone they sent him home with was uncomfortable looking and hard for me to take on and off. I quickly ordered this and was so glad I did! This cone has a nice soft collar and appears to be much more comfortable. This is also super easy to take on and off, so I can easily take on and off for meal times. This also wipes clean pretty easily. This cone made recovery much better all around and would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Get the medium for cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats that weigh about 10 lbs. I cannot imagine using the small. On my cats the medium is comfortably (see attached photos) on the second to last notch, meaning it can go a little bigger or smaller if needed. She is still able to eat with it on (low ceramic dish with wet food) but is unable to groom herself (which is what I needed). It was packed flat I'm actually pretty impressed overall.
customer_reviews.author: S. Theobald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my little 4 pound cat, and it fit her perfectly. She can move around comfortably and doesn't seem to mind it. My only gripe is , as another review mentioned, that the outer edge of the cone is covered in a fabric that gets dirty easily. On one hand the outer edge is colorful and probably helps her avoid bumping into things, and on the other hand it gets dirty easily. In any case, I highly recommend it, and my vet is looking into ordering some for her clinic.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Davis

customer_reviews.title: Better than the rest and cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought medium size for my 10lb cat. Cone is adjustable, snaps into place and is secure. I used second to last setting. Kitty needed a recovery cone to prevent her from scratching ears and pulling fur. This cone does the trick. Comfortable with soft padded material around the neck area. It's transparent, so doesn't obstruct view, Can eat , drink and use litter box with the cone on. Tip: move water and food bowls out from the wall and elevate them so they are accessible. Reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfy for their necks
customer_reviews.text: These were comfortable for my kittens although when I took them off so they could groom themselves they were itchy around the neck area. They were able to sleep in these, eat, even go to the bathroom. You have to take it off so they can clean themselves. Sometimes the rim gets wet from water or even pee or poop from the litter box and you need to clean it immediately. Love the soft part around the neck so it was comfy for them.
customer_reviews.author: fyergoddess

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: We had to buy this for our poor baby cat who we had to put down due to ear cancer. Towards the end it prevented her from digging like crazy into her ear. We got the small, and she was a tiny girl, only 7.4 pounds. She got around fairly well considering it was the only cone she has had to wear in her 12 years. It was short, so she could easily access water, we took it off for feeding, because we were feeding wet food and didn't want it to gunk up or smell, due to the fabic around the top.
customer_reviews.author: Saduryee

customer_reviews.title: Arrived 2 days early!
customer_reviews.text: Instantaneously the kitten was more relaxed, she took a small stroll around before going back to her bed to chill. Granted, she had been wearing the cone-shaped top of a 1gal. vinegar bottle which I cut into shape/size, which couldn't have been very comfortable, but was necessary to prevent her from getting to her hind quarters where her ouchy is. Haven't tried to wash it yet, and she currently hasn't the mobility to wreak havoc upon it, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Charles Compton

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller cats.
customer_reviews.text: When my cat needed a cone due to some minor ear surgery the cone the vet gave us was terrible. My cat almost liked this one and it was easier to manage, and more comfortable for her. Update. I ordered a second one. My 22 year old cat is looking at spending most of the rest of her life with a cone. (still eating and drinking, but has cancer in one ear). I needed another for her to use while the first was being cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not for big cats
customer_reviews.text: This cone is great, but not for big cats. The size is most likely for a kitten. We have a full grown white paw tabby (15ish lbs). The cone fit his neck perfectly, and hasn’t irritated him. However, he can somehow still lick his stomach, which is what we were trying to avoid. The cone comes with two adjustable settings, there is a fabric at the base and the top so that the cat isn’t irritated by it. It is really well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amzreview

customer_reviews.title: Nice Reusable Cone Collar
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice reusable cone collar. The challenge is that it snaps into place so if your cat is an in-between size it will either be too loose or too tight. I bought this for my cat who was having a reoccurring problem that required him to wear a cone. I also bought a cloth padded collar which was better but this one worked well when I had to wash the cloth one.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Great little e-collar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this collar for my puppy who is 8 weeks old and 3 pounds and just was spayed. I was looking for a collar that was somewhat clear so that she could see better. I have been pleased with the quality, and it's great that it has two sets of snaps to allow for different sizing. The plastic is easy to clean, but the combination of plastic and fabric means you will need to hand wash in the sink (as opposed to tossing in washer). I give this 4 stars, but this sweet little pup does not like wearing it, so don't ask for her review! :)
customer_reviews.author: spamcdtx

customer_reviews.title: Nice small cone, when not getting wet
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t find small enough cone from any store, but this fitted great on our 10 weeks old kitten. He got adjusted surprisingly well to his cone life and the soft base seemed fairly comfortable. The soft outer rim didn’t make much sense though, since it just soaks all water (or food/pee/anything) and makes it extra hard to keep clean. Sometimes our kitten managed to get also the base of the cone wet (from the water dripping from wet outer rim), but that material dries pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Maria K

customer_reviews.title: Great for small to medium cats
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a different small hard plastic cone from petco (my cat kept reopening a scratch scab on his head) . The store clerk said it works in cats and dogs. I put it on my cat and it stuck out too far beyond his face and irritated his neck so i returned it. I bought this product from Amazon and my cat was able to tolerate it and the scratch on his head healed in a few weeks!
customer_reviews.author: 808 Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: This just didn't work well for my adult cat. She suffers from skin allergies and was constantly licking and biting her fur, so while I treated her she had the collar on. It wasn't very easy to clean as hair got trapped in the rim of the cone. It was very difficult for her to eat. She was still able to scratch with the rim of the collar and scratch at her shoulders. This might work for a cat that has wounds on her abdominal area but I will be purchasing a full suit for my cat that looks like it will be easier for her to eat and covers all the areas.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: This is not a durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Really, I've come to the conclusion that this is a single experience cone. I opted for this ~$8 cone over the $12 cone from the vet to save a few dollars.. unfortunately, within the first two hours of my kitten using it, two of the snaps have come off... don't make the same mistake I did - purchase a different/better quality cone.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace the collar given to us by the emergency vet. Our cat had been disoriented and unable to maneuver -- only able to walk backwards -- in the vet-supplied collar. He quickly adapted to the new collar, and is back to acting like a cat. It seems to be comfortable and fits him perfectly. SInce we have only had it for a few days, I know nothing about keeping it clean or its durability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I have a geriatric kitty who seems to be hypersensitive about her ears and despite multiple vet visits and treatments, including the removal of the entire ear pinna on one side, still claws at them quite a bit and will self-mutilate. Oversized e-collars are a tremendous pain as is something too stiff. So after trying several that were either too big or too soft, I tried this one and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Tallulah

customer_reviews.title: Buy this before getting your cat spayed
customer_reviews.text: I own a tiny 7 lb. cat and the medium fits great using the second of the three buttons. The clasps snap tightly, which is reassuring because she knows how to work her way out of the cheap plastic cone provided by the vet. It also came with a little key chain. If you're getting your cat spayed, you should buy this beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: windmillion

customer_reviews.title: Snaps are impossible
customer_reviews.text: I ordered for my 16 year old adopted cat because she incessantly licking herself and bites, despite tropicals and other meds. Was excited for this cone. Well she never got to wear it. It appears like it would be comfy but the snaps don't connect! Not sure if I got a defective cone, but the one side of the snaps is like an "eye" shape and the other side is normal and round. It's like putting a triangle into a circle. They dont connect. I tried everything. Sending it back and hoping the next one I order can snap together! **EDIT** Ordered a 2nd cone. The snaps are great. Guess the first one was just defective.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS THE WORST CAT CONE I bought this cat cone for my 6 month year old kitten I bought the small thinking that would fit my kitten IT DIDEN'T over ll we returned the can cone. And made a DIY cat cone for free out of a paper plate. Whats sad is that the paper plate worked better than this one that we bought. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS CAT CONE TO ANYONE... this photo shows the size of my cat she is a kitten
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R Medina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable For Our Cat
customer_reviews.text: Our 17 year old cat had surgery and needed to wear a "cone of shame" for two very long weeks. This one made a terrible situation tolerable. The fabric around the neck was much more comfortable for her and the clear plastic kept her peripheral vision. And I'm sure she was comforted in knowing she looked cute in pink dots. The small size is for kittens; the medium fit perfectly for our adult cat.
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best option! Better with the buttons than velcro!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other recovery collars on my cat and this one is the best one by far. For sneaky cats, this one is not easy to remove. Medium was the best option for my adult cat and I have the alternative of three different settings for her neck. This is better with the buttons than velcro. At least my cat is comfortable with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Diana G.

customer_reviews.title: Collar should be longer and have less flare.
customer_reviews.text: While the collar worked for my cat, I agree with other reviewers who complain that their animals can still scratch their faces. The injury to my cat is far enough back on his jaw that he can't scratch it, but if it was farther up on his face he would be able to. However, the collar is secure. My cat got out of the one the vet gave me and managed to lose it someplace so I had to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jeffrey Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. Way too small for my adult cat, who is really just average sized. May work for a small kitten but the cat posted in the photo is most certainly not a kitten. I also think that despite it being see-through, the stiffness of it would really annoy my cat. Of course he hates all cones, but seemed to be better able to maneuver his bowls and litterbox, as well as nap, with a soft fabric cone.
customer_reviews.author: Arya

customer_reviews.title: It'll Do
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, but does the job. Comfortable enough to sleep in, clear enough, but not for the dog. He hates it. Did prevent him from getting to his wound. It's got a funny bend in it. Not completely circular. Bought a medium for my 6 pound dog. Recommend you measure the neck before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: RaShonda

customer_reviews.title: Fits my small dogs neck perfectly I got the medium and my dogs neck is 7 inches to 8.
customer_reviews.text: Fits her great she is having a spay soon and they said to bring your own head cone or you have to buy one from them for 20.00 dollars and it is hard white plastic and this one is soft and she can lay down in it just fine. I was worried if it would fit but if your dog is 7 inches or more it will work fine. under 7 inches go for the small.
customer_reviews.author: April8181

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was just a little bit longer
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after our cat had surgery on her back leg, in order to prevent her from licking her incisions. The cone the vet gave us was junk and she kept getting it off, repeatedly. Over the week and a half she had this cone on, she was only able to get it off twice. And that probably wouldn’t have happened if I would have made it a little bit tighter. Only thing that would make it better, is to make the cone longer. My cat was able to lick her tail and back leg a couple times after really working at it. This cone is not as long as the cones the vet gives out.
customer_reviews.author: Ellyce

customer_reviews.title: Only good for one use.
customer_reviews.text: It served it purpose of assisting the healing of my cat. My cat had some skin problems on her tail end where she would chew to it was raw. I placed it on my cat, and of course she didn't like it and fought to take off. It stayed in placed, but the fabric wore out pretty fast. I will not be reusing it if the need arises. Only good for one use.
customer_reviews.author: bobguy421

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short while
customer_reviews.text: Although this did its job, it won’t for much longer. I bought this for my parrot so I could cut her nails. Getting it on was easy but she was chewing her way through it. My husband had to hold the top of the cone. If you have a passive animal you may be ok but if you have a rambunctious pet, you may need to get a stronger cone.
customer_reviews.author: MJ VanHecker

customer_reviews.title: Medium too large for a 6 lb cat
customer_reviews.text: The medium was too large for my senior 6 lb cat. I’m hesitant to try the small from all the other reviews. I do like the cone, it was easy to put on (though very easy for her to slip out of). I plan on using this for my larger cats if they ever need it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My cat acted pretty normally with this on and did not try to remove it. she was able to see through it well so played and romped with it in place. The small one fit my 3 month old kitten perfectly. Just got a little dirty when she ate wet food. I just wiped it off and moved on. I like the quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to use when giving cats a bath so they can't bite ya
customer_reviews.text: Great to use for when giving cats a bath. Most of them hate or are afraid of water. I would save cones from the vet and use them to give the cats a bath. This way the fidgeting ones could not bite which is goid for both of us. Have not been to the vet in awhile so thank you Amazon for always having what I need!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Prickett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ecollar
customer_reviews.text: My cat had exploratory surgery and quickly bent the cloth ecollar the vet gave us which allowed him to get to his surgery wound. I was worried this cone wouldn’t be able to prevent him from reaching the very bottom of the inscision but it actually works perfect and he seems much more comfortable in this one since he can see better around it. The snaps make it super easy to put it on your kitty as well, it only took about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Too short...
customer_reviews.text: Too bad it runs small. The depth is too shallow so my dog still can chew and lick the lower half of her body. The fabric part which is an inch long folds so it doesn’t keep them from they are rathergetting to the back half. I have a Shihtzu so they are rather long. If you have a short dog it will probably work.
customer_reviews.author: Cherryblossom

customer_reviews.title: Persistent cat? Nope...
customer_reviews.text: Great if your cat isn't adamant to get it off. It took my cat 10 minutes to get it off. Due to the nature of it being fabric around the neck area she was able to get it off with enough work at it. Quality otherwise though...seems sturdy. would be great for a tiny dog without the claws able to pull at it.
customer_reviews.author: utopiaexists

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but hard to climb with for cat
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10 lb cat who has a paw injury. She got a medium which fits very well on the smallest notch. She can drink and see through it which makes it better than the ones she’s had before, but it is a little too far from her face and so it gets caught on the stairs and litter box when she’s trying to climb or get in. I had to take it off but decided to keep it as it was functional otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Dee McGee

customer_reviews.title: Great collar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The cloth strip that is attached to the wide end of the cone is, in my opinion, not necessary. I know it completes the "look or style", but it also gave my cat something to hook her claws into and yank the collar off twice. We just simply removed that piece and it has been working as expected ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Manasco

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for our cat!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for us. Our handsome older cat (16 1/2 yrs young) started to have severe skin issues and we needed an easy way to keep him from licking and making his skin worse. Before we got this nothing helped. This is very easy to put on, is easily adjustable, and easy to clean. Our vet approved as well. Our cat is very laid back and does not complain about anything so this works perfect. His neck is 9” around and he weighs 11 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Kittens
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my kitten. She could see through it so she never bumped into walls. And flexible enough to be able to sleep in it. We only took it off for her to eat wet food. But we could have left it on. And she was never able to get to her stitches on her tummy. Our kitten only weighed 4 lbs. And measured 7 inches around her neck. But it could have gone a little smaller. I don't regret buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: May not work for all situations but great for foster care
customer_reviews.text: When you have a cat that has to wear a “cone” for months it was important to have comfort and be able to swap to a clean collar quickly. This style was a game changer. The vet loved it. He didn’t tip food and water dish. Was able to relax and hang out. It would not prevent him from chewing on toes (which is fine: he needed his eyes protected). I have now used on a cat with a severe skin infection and it was perfect
customer_reviews.author: RDobbs259

customer_reviews.title: Fits on adult calico cat who has an ear hematoma ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits on adult calico cat who has an ear hematoma. She is unable to scratch at her ear and irritate it anymore. May actually need to buy another one since she has used it as a scoop in the litter box. She only was able to get it off once in the first week of wearing it, but that was because she got stuck somewhere. Can't beat the price. She does wear it on the 2nd to last button around the neck and the last button on the end away from the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! I really like that is has a soft fabric area around the neck to make it for comfortable. I was actually able to fold this area back so the cone didn’t stick out as much and she was able to eat and drink more easily but still kept her from biting/licking herself. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Blindsighted_Angel

customer_reviews.title: Product does what it is designed to do...
customer_reviews.text: This cone fit our 12 lb. cat just fine. He had gotten into a scrap and had a battle wound on one of his rear flanks. Because he wouldn't stop aggravating it, we had to do something. It was snug, but after the cone was snapped around our kitty's neck, we could still get 2 fingers underneath the edge. He resisted it at first but within a few minutes resigned himself to his temporary fate. Did create somewhat of a challenge when it came to meals, but he worked around it. Go with the size listed.
customer_reviews.author: AKB

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as shown in picture. Love that it's see through so my cat won't completely freak out. Obviously she isn't going to love wearing it, especially at first, so I'm not complaining. It works for keeping her from her licking herself raw, leaving wounds. Hopefully this will help train her out of that and grow her fur back. Fits great, make sure to get the medium if you have an adult cat. The small would definitely only be for kittens. 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Leah and Cody Layton

customer_reviews.title: More comfy & less invasive than the plastic one from the vet
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this cone for my 1.5 year old tabby. She had a hot spot on her arm and the cone the vet gave us was huge, pressed her ears, was heavy, and not soft around the neck. Went with a small...wasn't sure this one would be big enough, but it is! The buttons let us keep the neck button undone (a bit too tight when buttoned imo) and just do the cone button. Much less invasive, covers her head less (still prevents her from licking her arm) and gives her better vision. Easier for her to move around. We're all very happy about it!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory JM

customer_reviews.title: Buy it...worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Throw away the plastic vet collar and buy this! It is comfortable for the pet and allows them to eat as well as drink more easily. It is also more forgiving when they bump into things since is soft around the neck. Easier for them to sleep more comfortably. Ordered the medium for Our 9 lb cat is who is petite. It fit perfectly on the second to last snaps. Worth the extra money. Thinking of spraying the fabric collar with calming pheromones
customer_reviews.author: KatB

customer_reviews.title: No good at all
customer_reviews.text: My honest opinion this product is a waste of money, I had to return it, I put it as tight as possible and my cat took it off, mind you this thing is so big my cat was bumping into everything til he got mad and took it off himself, just use the cheap one the vet gives you its simple
customer_reviews.author: allproper

customer_reviews.title: Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: Way too small for any adult cat. Maybe if I ever get a lizard and it needs a cone it could come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: jtom

customer_reviews.title: Life savor!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous at first because I didn't think the cone would fit my 16lb male Cale (I got the size medium), and he looked a bit stuffed, I used the very first buttons too. I closely monitored him for a while with the cone on and he absolutely loved it, his demeanor changed so quickly from the vet cone to this one! He was able to sleep by the window (his favorite spot), and didn't look sad or depressed like he did with the vet cone. He's also able to eat a lot better! He's been wearing it for 5 days now and is able to sleep in the most interesting positions with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Quang

customer_reviews.title: Magical cone
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if my cat is just the "goodest boy in the world" or if this cone is magical! He let's me put it on without any problem at all. He seems to be as comfortable as a cat can be with a cone around its neck. He hasn't tried taking it off and it's been 5 days so I'm very glad about that and how he is healing. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leonia54

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats who need eye/head/ear protection
customer_reviews.text: I wish we had found this collar sooner. Our cat is solid white and has sensitive skin; she developed a lesion above her left eye. She kept scratching and irritating it despite all our efforts to avoid putting her in a cone. The plastic cone provided by the vet really disoriented her and made it very challenging to eat/drink. We tried a couple of others on Amazon, but this was the best. She is about 8-9 pounds and the small fits her perfectly. It is smaller and less bulky so she is much more comfortable. Cats come in all shapes and sizes with varied needs for E collars, but this one has been a wonderful relief for us.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put on and take off. Very easy to clean and disinfect as well- I even sprayed it with bleach water and then washed it with soap after many uses. It never Changed its color, and dries quickly- I just left it to drip outside and it was ready in less than an hour. And my cat didn’t “complain” wearing it at all 😊.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a 3 month old kitten fresh from surgery. She was not able to get out of it at all. The only problem I saw was that it got dirty fast, like when they were eating or drinking and during litterbox usage. Easy fix was to take it off for a few minutes when necessary. Easy to clean but seemed to take forever to dry. Worth buying and very decently priced.
customer_reviews.author: Christina A

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, clear view.
customer_reviews.text: The size Small Cone fits my 5 month old kitten perfect (post-spay). She weighs 5 lbs. and I snapped the snaps for bigger expand. So if you’re kitty is more than 5 lbs. I’d recommend a size Medium. The cone is excellent quality and gives the kitty clear peripheral view.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loved this
customer_reviews.text: We used a cone that was not clear and slightly larger for our cat the first time it was needed. That was an awful experience. This clear cone was smaller and allowed the little fella to see what was happening around him. It was great and he hardly noticed it. His brother was bothered with the other cone because it looked crazy. The clear one we bought allowed him to see his brothers face and not constantly get run in to. I would never buy another non-clear cone for an animal. This was 100x better. Strongly suggest purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t use this for cats. The part that goes around the neck bunches up and it’s basically useless. Also my cat loves to lick and he got his tongue stick on the fabric, how? I have no idea. So right now I have the one from the vet on he can get off periodically until I can find a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Amaes

customer_reviews.title: The collar is the perfect length to prevent her from scratching her belly stitches ...
customer_reviews.text: The small collar fit my 5 month old cat perfectly! The collar is the perfect length to prevent her from scratching her belly stitches and gives her the ability to eat, drink, and see what's around her. The snaps hold in place and do not bother her.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great buy medium size for over an year old cat
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure of the size I got an medium for my 16 month old kitty and since its slightly adjustable with snaps it fits perfectly yes he can pull it off but he has to really work at it so I think uts an great buy a protect him from scratching is ouchy.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy shopper gotto have it

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: First, the Medium fits a fairly small dog, so be sure you measure... The "red" is not red, but rather a "hot pink"... not that my dog cared, but if it matters to you, you might want to note the colors as a little off. The soft part around the neck does cause the cone to loose a little of the height, so he is able to contort a little and still scratch his ears, but it has definitely kept him from doing it as much. Overall, it's OK for the cost... If you just need it couple of days use, it will do the job for you.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great cone for a small cat
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the cone from the vet! My <1 year old sphynx was way too small for her vet cone and couldn’t easy eat her food or go to the litter box without dragging it through. This cone works perfect and by day 3 she seems like she’s tolerating the whole situation very well.
customer_reviews.author: Akiko

product_meta.title: Bolbove Pet Plastic Clear Cone Recovery E-Collar with Dots Design Soft Edge for Small Dogs & Cats
product_meta.description:
Size:Small| Color:Rose RedIt may take a little time for your pet to adjust to wearing a cone, but by projecting a positive attitude, providing plenty of treats, and learning a little more about the benefits of the cone, your pet will have better chances of recovering sooner. 

The cones are made for Kitties, Cats, Small Breeds, Puppies, Rabbits. 
We have 2 sizes for this recovery collar: simply measure your pet's Neck Girth with a flexible tape to make sure a good fit, we recommend one size up for comfort if your dog's measurement is the higher end of the range listed. 
Size Small: fits pet Neck Girth 5.5" to 6.5" with the overall depth of 3.5" 
Size Medium:fits pet Neck Girth 7.2" to 9.5" with the overall depth of 4.7" 

Package included: 
1* Pet Recovery Collar 
1*Silver Metal Bolbove Keychain
feature_bullets: Size Small (For Kitties and Teacups) : fits pet Neck Girth 5.5" to 6.5" with the overall depth of 3.5" (simply measure your pet's Neck Girth with a flexible tape to make sure a good fit, We recommend one size up for comfort if your dog's measurement is the higher end of the range listed.)
Made for Kitties, Cats, Small Breeds, Puppies, Rabbits
Prevents scratching and biting at injuries, stitches, rashes, and wounds
Made of lightweight plastic and soft fabric edge for your puppies or kitties to eat, sleep, drink and lay their head in comfort
Unique button closure enables pets owner to keep the collar secure in place and keep it from being pulled off or from falling off, fold flat for easy storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
